thread.title: Bethlehem, Pennsylvania: the town that built America – in pictures
thread.title_full: Bethlehem, Pennsylvania: the town that built America – in pictures

author: Sarah Gilbert
title: Bethlehem, Pennsylvania: the town that built America – in pictures
text:
Bethlehem, Pennsylvania: the town that built America – in pictures Bethlehem, Pennsylvania: the town that built America – in pictures View more sharing options Share on Messenger Close 
Bethlehem Steel produced most of America’s steel and was the country’s largest shipbuilder. Based in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, the company provided steel for the buildings that would make up New York’s skyline, for bridges and dams across the US, and for the warships of the navy. The company’s 2001 closing is often seen as emblematic of the shift away from industrial manufacturing in America Wednesday 18 January 2017 07.00 GMT A postcard shows a view of the Bethlehem Steel facilities and grounds, circa 1912 Photograph: Library of Congress Artillery production in 1918, part of Bethlehem Steel’s contribution to the first world war Photograph: Historical/Corbis via Getty Images An early image of the blast furnace at the Bethlehem Steel works in Pennsylvania Photograph: Library of Congress/Corbis/VCG via Getty Images A worker pauses near the top of the George Washington Bridge as it is built around 1930 using Bethlehem steel Photograph: Hulton Archive/Getty Images The Chrysler Building, for which Bethlehem Steel provided materials, under construction around 1929 Photograph: Edwin Levick/Getty Images Construction workers raise the American flag at the Rockefeller Center on 26 April 1932, standing on steel beams from Bethlehem Steel Photograph: Bettmann/Getty Images A 1933 view of the Boulder Dam in Nevada, later renamed the Hoover Dam, for which Bethlehem Steel provided material Photograph: Library of Congress/Corbis/VCG via Getty Images A view of the construction of the Golden Gate Bridge with the roadbed being installed in 1937 Photograph: Underwood Archives/Getty Images Female welders at the Bethlehem Steel Shipyard during the second world war Photograph: Bettmann/Getty Images Alcatraz prison in the San Francisco Bay. Bethlehem steel was used in its construction Photograph: Bettmann/Getty Images The battleship USS Missouri, in action in the Pacific in 1945, was one of more than 1,000 ships built by Bethlehem Photograph: AP
